data.meanings: to sift, send down, snow, drizzle, cloud, select, pick out the best of. nakhal lahuu alnasiihaten - to give earnest advice.
data.sentence: The word وَالنَّخْلَ comes from the root ن خ ل and is associated with the meanings: to sift, send down, snow, drizzle, cloud, select, pick out the best of. nakhal lahuu alnasiihaten - to give earnest advice.

data.meanings: tall, full grown, overcame/surpassed, excelled, became superior / exalted above.
data.sentence: The word بَاسِقَاتٍ comes from the root ب س ق and is associated with the meanings: tall, full grown, overcame/surpassed, excelled, became superior / exalted above.

data.meanings: to ascend/rise, go up, learn, come on, come towards anyone, start from, climb upon, reach, sprout, notice, look, seek, examine, expose, explain, appear, inform, occur, consider, know. tal'un - the spathe or sheath in which the flowers of the date palm are enclosed, also the fruit when it first appears, fruit, ranged dates. tuluu - rising. matla'un - twilight of rising (of sun). atla'a (vb. 4) - to make manifest to anyone, cause one to understand. ittala'a for itta'ala'a (vb. 8) - to mount up, penetrate. attala'a for a'attala'a - has he penetrated (here the hamzah of union waslah being omitted after the interrogative hamzah).
data.sentence: The word طَلْعٌ comes from the root ط ل ع and is associated with the meanings: to ascend/rise, go up, learn, come on, come towards anyone, start from, climb upon, reach, sprout, notice, look, seek, examine, expose, explain, appear, inform, occur, consider, know. tal'un - the spathe or sheath in which the flowers of the date palm are enclosed, also the fruit when it first appears, fruit, ranged dates. tuluu - rising. matla'un - twilight of rising (of sun). atla'a (vb. 4) - to make manifest to anyone, cause one to understand. ittala'a for itta'ala'a (vb. 8) - to mount up, penetrate. attala'a for a'attala'a - has he penetrated (here the hamzah of union waslah being omitted after the interrogative hamzah).

data.meanings: to pile up one over the other, set in order.
data.sentence: The word نَضِيدٌ comes from the root ن ض د and is associated with the meanings: to pile up one over the other, set in order.
